moves.1. e4 e5 2. d3: Indian Opening.  This one tends to be better for black.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Be2 Bc5 4. Nc3 h6: Unless white plans to put something at g5 these edge pawn moves are kind of weak.  Better to develop the center.
moves.5. Nd5 Nf6: Ah, in this instance the pawn move (h6) makes good sense.
moves.6. Be3 Bxe3 7. Nxe3 d6 8. Nf3 Bg4 9. Ng1: Shifting back and forth wastes opportunity.
moves.16. h4 a5 17. Nc3 Qc6 18. f3 Ng6 19. Ng4: Watch out for Nb6 forking the queen and rook.
moves.23... b4: Blunder.  White now trades knight for rook.
moves.24. Nb6 Qb7 25. Nc4: What?  Trade knight for rook ANY day and twice on Sunday!
moves.25... Rfd8 26. h5 Ne7 27. Qf3 bxa3: Rab8 might have been better first.
